author: Special Correspondent
text:
The sessions court on Wednesday allowed the Central Bureau of Investigation to interrogate Indrani Mukerjea, her husband Peter Mukerjea, former husband Sanjeev Khanna and driver Shyamvar Rai, all accused in the Sheena Bora murder case, following the agency’s plea for further examination of the accused for 10 days.

All four were remanded in judicial custody till March 17. Indrani and Peter were produced in court together for the first time since their arrests in August and November 2015.

The CBI said in its application that it wanted to interrogate Peter, Khanna and Rai to extract more information/evidence and verify certain facts that emerged during the investigation.

“During the investigation, the mobile handset of Mr Mukerjea has been seized which is password protected by his thumb impression. Mr. Mukerjea’s thumb impression would be obtained on the seized mobile phone to open the said mobile phone,” the application stated.

Meanwhile, Peter had asked for the call data records obtained by the agency which were not included in the charge sheet. The court will hear his plea at a later date.
title: CBI allowed to quiz Peter, Indrani in Sheena case
